section.title: DCN Integration with Multisite Support for Neutron
section.para: HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) is network overlay software that enables network virtualization both within data centers and between them. &kw-hos; allows you to use DCN as your networking. This choice is an all-or-nothing option in that you cannot use traditional networking in &kw-hos; if you choose to use DCN.

For that reason, and others, you cannot upgrade an existing installation of &kw-hos; to &kw-hos; with DCN. The network configuration you had previously will not work. Therefore, to use DCN, you must install &kw-hos; as a new deployment, and follow the steps outlined in these documents.

section.title: Features not available when DCN is deployed
section.para: Because of the foundational differences between DCN networks and traditional networking, when DCN is running in &kw-hos;, these features are not deployed:

listitem.para: Neutron-server must be running with either the Nuage mechanism driver (DCN-ML2) or the core-plugin (DCN-CORE-PLG). DCN-ML2 is preferred.
VRS with the Nuage metadata-agent and VRS-G. VRS runs on compute nodes, VRS-G runs on a standalone node.
(Optional): Virtualized services controller (VSC) There are two ways to have VSC(s) deployed, one via playbooks and another via bringing up the provided VSC VM disk image.
